intro: Pavetta middelburgensis, commonly known as the Middelburg pavetta, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, featuring small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a tubular corolla. Pavetta middelburgensis is often found in rocky or sandy soils in forested areas.
